file_content.text: The Empire may be calling the shots at Okara now, but they don't own me! This is a golden opportunity!
The day I take orders from an Imperial collaborator is the day I marry a Gamorrean. Now beat it, Natho.
Great. The Empire overruns my workplace, and suddenly I'm a traitor. I'm in a perfect position to ruin their operations, but the Republic won't even hear me out.
Where exactly do you work?
Your workplace?
The Okara Droid Factory--which the Empire controls now. Not ideal employers.
If you've got a plan to sabotage the Empire, let's hear it.
What are you up to?
Gladly.
Can't blame the Republic for not trusting you if you still work with the Imperials.
I wouldn't believe you.
It's not like I'm killing Jedi. I build droids--poor ones, at that. But that's just deliberate laziness. It's time for some outright sabotage.
For the past few months, my factory's been putting together a massive shipment of battle droids for the Empire.
In the interest of "quality assurance," I developed a virus and uploaded it to one of the droids, just to see what would happen.
The droid malfunctioned--violently. Now imagine if we infected the entire shipment of droids with that virus....
The Empire would have a horde of rampaging battle droids to deal with.
They'd be in big trouble.
An incident like that could shake the Empire's faith in droids altogether. It's just a matter of distributing the virus to all the units.
Infecting that many droids sounds more complicated than infecting one.
It can't be that simple.
Maybe, but thanks to the Empire's obsession with efficiency, the groundwork for spreading the virus has already been laid out.
We've been using special relay droids to upload all the necessary programming to the combat models.
If we infect the relay droids, they should transmit the virus to the rest. I'd do it myself, but they're guarded by sentry drones.
If you can get past those sentries and upload the virus, you'll corrupt thousands of the Empire's droids. Will you do it?
I doubt those sentries can stand up to a lightsaber. I'll upload your virus.
Leave it to me.
You've already sacrificed enough for the Republic. Leave the rest to me.
I'll finish what you started.
The Republic can't afford to let a tactical opportunity like this slip by. Count me in.
I'll handle this.
My ship could use the scrap metal. I'm in.
I'll do it.
It's about time someone listened. Thank you.
Last I checked, the relay droids were still circling the factory. Use this transmitter to upload the virus when you get close enough to them.
I guess I'll just keep pestering the Republic....
The Okara droids are turning on the Imperials. I can't believe Natho was right.
Careful around those sentry droids. For your sake, I hope Natho's virus works.
I don't have time for this, Natho. You're jamming my channel. Again. Don't you have work to do?
The day I take orders from an Imperial collaborator is the day I marry a Gamorrean. Buzz off!
So what's your plan?
Where are the droids?
I've been scouting this area for the Republic. If this means Natho will stop comming me, I'll help.
The relay droids he's talking about are at these coordinates, near the Okara Droid Factory. The virus is on there too.
If the virus actually works, contact me at the Okara Droid Factory public terminal. There might be more we can do.
It's your job. [Refuse quest]
Another time, huh? I need to transmit these scouting reports to the Republic.
This is Sergeant Forren. Can't broadcast this over the comm-- contact me on the Okara Droid Factory public access terminal.
